snippet: The series mocks all sides in the country’s unrest, from President Bashar al-Assad to the Free Syrian Army, which provides the crew security during filming.
abstract: Gaziantep Journal; creators of television series Banned in Syria have risked life and limb to produce work that satirizes all sides in country's civil war; show is filmed in war-torn streets of Allepo and two crew members for Lamba Productions have died during filming; creators see work as a continuation of the revolution and a much-needed cultural alternative to government of Pres Bashar al-Assad.
lead_paragraph: The series mocks all sides in the country’s unrest, from President Bashar al-Assad to the Free Syrian Army, which provides the crew security during filming.

headline.print_headline: A Syrian Parody Features the Civil War, and Is Stalked by It
headline.main: A Syrian Parody Features the Civil War, and Is Stalked by It
